questions.questionText: Which of the following is a correct way to declare a variable in Python?
What is the type of a variable declared as `x = 3.14` in Python?
Which function can be used to get the type of a variable in Python?
Which of the following is a mutable data type in Python?
How do you create a constant variable in Python?
Which of the following is NOT a valid variable name in Python?
How do you assign multiple variables in Python?
Which of the following is NOT a built-in data type in Python?
What is the result of `type(True)` in Python?
How do you delete a variable in Python?

title: Advanced Variable Handling in Java and Python

questions.questionText: In Java, which of the following is true about local variables?
answerOptions: Local variables must be manually initialized
Local variables can be used anywhere in the class
Local variables do not exist in Java
questions.correctAnswer: Local variables must be manually initialized

questions.questionText: What will happen if you try to change a final variable in Java?
answerOptions: It will throw a runtime error
It will cause a compile-time error
It will not affect the variable
questions.correctAnswer: It will cause a compile-time error

questions.questionText: In Python, which keyword is used to define global variables?
What is a static variable in Java?
answerOptions: A variable that retains its value across instances
A variable that changes value across instances
A variable declared inside a method
questions.correctAnswer: A variable that retains its value across instances

questions.questionText: In Python, how are variables passed to a function?
answerOptions: Python doesn't support passing variables to functions

questions.questionText: Which of the following best describes the `static` keyword in Java?
answerOptions: It is used to create a class-level variable or method
It is used to make a variable immutable
It is used to initialize variables
It is used to define constants
questions.correctAnswer: It is used to create a class-level variable or method

questions.questionText: In Python, which data type is immutable?
In Java, can a local variable in a method be declared as static?
How do you define a private variable in Python?
answerOptions: By prefixing the variable name with `__`
By adding `_` before the variable name
Private variables are not allowed in Python
questions.correctAnswer: By prefixing the variable name with `__`

questions.questionText: What is the scope of a variable declared inside a loop in Python?
answerOptions: The scope is limited to the loop
The scope is limited to the block
It is accessible after the loop as well
questions.correctAnswer: It is accessible after the loop as well
